Bluetooth 5.4, A2DP, LE | water_resist = IP68 | other = | sar = | hac = | website = * {{URL|https://www.mi.com/xiaomi-14/}} * {{URL| https://www.mi.com/xiaomi-14-pro/}} | references = {{cite web |url= https://www.gsmarena.com/xiaomi_14-12626.php|title= Xiaomi 14|last= |first= |date= 1 November 2023|website= GSMArena|publisher= |access-date= |quote=}}{{cite web |url= https://www.gsmarena.com/xiaomi_14_pro-12643.php|title= Xiaomi 14 Pro|last= |first= |date= 1 November 2023|website= GSMArena|publisher= |access-date= |quote=}} }} The '''Xiaomi 14''' is a series of [[Android (operating system)|Android]]-based [[smartphone]]s manufactured by [[Xiaomi]] that succeeds the [[Xiaomi 13]] series. The series is the company's flagship{{Cite web |title=The Xiaomi 14 is probably coming to Europe, but the 14 Pro might not |url=https://www.techadvisor.com/article/1985782/xiaomi-14.html |access-date=2024-02-01 |website=Tech Advisor |language=en}} range. The Xiaomi 14 and 14 Pro, the first phones to feature a [[Qualcomm Snapdragon]] 8 Gen 3 [[System On Chip]],{{cite web |url= https://indianexpress.com/article/technology/tech-news-technology/snapdragon-8-gen-3-soc-powered-smartphones-8998475/|title= From OnePlus 12 to Xiaomi 14: Smartphones confirmed to feature Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 SoC|last= |first= |date= 1 November 2023|website=|publisher= |access-date= |quote=}} were announced on 26 October 2023 and were released in [[China]] on 1 November 2023. The Xiaomi 14 Ultra was released on February 22, 2024, in China alongside the Xiaomi Pad 6S Pro.{{Cite news |date=February 23, 2024 |title=The Xiaomi 14 Ultra is now official: will it dominate the 2024 camera phone arena? |url=https://www.phonearena.com/news/xiaomi-14-ultra-is-official_id155629 |work=[[PhoneArena]]}} The global launch of the Xiaomi 14 series happened at MWC 2024 on February 25, 2024, in [[Barcelona]], [[Spain]].{{Cite web |title=Xiaomi 14 series release date officially announced on February 25 in Barcelona |url=https://crazreview.com/xiaomi-14-series-release-date-announced/ |access-date=February 24, 2024 |website=[[CrazReview]]|date=7 February 2024 }} == Design == [[File:小米14 Pro和小米14（2024年2月20日）.jpg|left|thumb|The front of the Xiaomi 14 Pro and Xiaomi 14 and color options of the Xiaomi 14]] [[File:HK 中環 Central 皇后大道中 33 Queen's Road Central shop 豐澤電器 Fortress Store 手機 smartphone XiaoMi 14 Ultra watch May 2024 R12S 01.jpg|left|thumb|The Xiaomi 14 Ultra ({{abbr|L|left}}) and Xiaomi Watch 2 ({{abbr|R|right}})]] The Xiaomi 14 features a flat front made of [[Corning Inc.|Corning]] [[Gorilla Glass|Gorilla Glass Victus]], meanwhile the Xiaomi 14 Pro has a front with curved side edges made of in-house Xiaomi Shield (Longjing) Glass.{{Cite web |last=Ivan |title=Xiaomi 14 and 14 Pro are here with HyperOS and revamped Leica cameras |url=https://www.gsmarena.com/the_xiaomi_14_and_14_pro_are_here_with_new_design_and_main_leica_cameras-news-60378.php |access-date=2024-08-10 |website=GSMArena.com |language=en-US}} The Xiaomi 14 Ultra, as the Pro model, features a front made of Shield Glass but it is curved around the perimeter, though not as prominently as on the sides of the Pro model. The back of the Xiaomi 14 is made of a silicone polymer material in the Snow Mountain Powder color option and glass in other color options, the Xiaomi 14 Pro features the back made of glass in all color options, while on the Xiaomi 14 Ultra it is made of glass in the Dragon Crystal Blue color and [[Plant-based leather|eco leather]] in other color options. The frame of all three models is generally made of [[aluminium]] but the Xiaomi 14 Pro and Xiaomi 14 Ultra offer Titanium Special Editions with the [[titanium]] frame. The only noticeable design change of the Xiaomi 14 compared to the [[Xiaomi 13]] is the camera island, which has no dividing lines and features a different arrangement of elements, such as three camera lenses, [[Light-emitting diode|LED]] flash and [[Leica Camera|Leica]] logo. The Xiaomi 14 Pro, compared to the Xiaomi 13 Pro, features a flatter back and a consistent frame width on all sides. Meanwhile, the Xiaomi 14 Ultra retains mostly identical to its predecessor design but includes the bezel around the camera island{{Cite web |last=Yordan |title=Xiaomi 14 Ultra leaked renders reveal minor design changes |url=https://www.gsmarena.com/xiaomi_14_ultra_leaked_renders_reveal_minor_design_changes-news-61589.php |access-date=2024-08-10 |website=GSMArena.com |language=en-US}} and lacks a bump on the upper part of the back. All modes have [[IP code|IP68]] dust and water resistance. On the bottom side, there is a [[dual SIM]] tray, a [[microphone]], a [[USB-C]] port and a [[Loudspeaker|speaker]]. On the top of the Xiaomi 14 Pro and Xiaomi 14 Ultra there is a second speaker. On the right side, there is the volume rocker and the power button. Elements such as the [[Infrared Data Association|IR port]], an additional microphone have been moved to the camera island.{{Cite web |date=2024-03-11 |title=Xiaomi 14 Review: Good Things Come in Small Packages |url=https://www.gadgets360.com/mobiles/reviews/xiaomi-14-review-5220557 |access-date=2024-08-10 |website=Gadgets 360 |language=en}} On the global market, the Xiaomi 14 is available in [[black]], [[white]], and Jade [[Green]] color options. In [[China]], the Xiaomi 14 is also available in Snow Mountain Powder ([[pink]]). The Xiaomi 14 Pro is available in black, white, Jade Green, and Titanium Special Edition color options. On the global market, the Xiaomi 14 Ultra is available in black and white color options. In China, the Xiaomi 14 Ultra is also available in Dragon Crystal [[Blue]] and Titanium Special Edition. {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="2" |Xiaomi 14 ! colspan="2" |Xiaomi 14 Pro ! colspan="2" |Xiaomi 14 Ultra |- !Color !Name !Color !Name !Color !Name |- | bgcolor="black" | ||Black | bgcolor="black" | |Black | bgcolor="black" | | Black |- | bgcolor="white" | ||White | bgcolor="white" | |White | bgcolor="white" | |White |- | bgcolor="#556b5f" | ||Jade Green | bgcolor="#556b5f" | |Jade Green | bgcolor="#95b7dc" | |Dragon Crystal Blue |- | bgcolor="pink" | ||Snow Mountain Powder | bgcolor="#5a5a5a" | |Titanium Special Edition | bgcolor="5a5a5a" | |Titanium Special Edition |} == Specifications == === Hardware === ==== Platform ==== The Xiaomi 14 and Xiaomi 14 Pro are the first smartphones to receive the flagship [[Qualcomm]] [[List of Qualcomm Snapdragon systems on chips#Snapdragon 8/8s Gen 3 (2024)|Snapdragon 8 Gen 3]] [[System on a chip|SoC]] with an [[Adreno]] 750 [[Graphics processing unit|GPU]].{{Cite web |date=2024-03-01 |title=Xiaomi 14 and Xiaomi 14 Pro: Release date, price, colors, everything else! |url=https://www.androidauthority.com/xiaomi-14-3355519/ |access-date=2024-08-11 |website=Android Authority |language=en}} The Xiaomi 14 Ultra uses the same platform. ==== Battery ==== The smartphones feature non-removable [[Lithium polymer battery|Li-Po batteries]] with a capacity of 4610 [[Ampere-hour|mAh]] in the Xiaomi 14, 4880 mAh in the Xiaomi 14 Pro, 5000 mAh in the global model of the Xiaomi 14 Ultra and 5300 mAh in the Chinese model of the Xiaomi 14 Ultra. The Xiaomi 14 and 14 Ultra support 90 W fast wired charging and the Xiaomi 14 Pro supports 120 W fast wired charging. The Xiaomi 14 and Xiaomi 14 Pro also support 50 W fast wireless charging and the Xiaomi 14 Ultra supports a 80 W fast wireless charging, which, at the time of release, is the most powerful wireless charging since the [[Xiaomi Mi 11 Ultra]]. All three models feature a 5 W reverse wireless charging support. ==== Camera ==== Xiaomi 14 and Xiaomi 14 Pro feature a triple camera setup consisting of the following lenses: * 50 MP [[wide-angle lens]] with an ''f/1.6'' [[aperture]] on the base model and an adjustable aperture ranging from ''f/1.4'' to ''f/4.0'' on the Pro model, featuring [[Autofocus#Phase detection|phase detection]] dual pixel autofocus, laser autofocus, and [[Image stabilization#Optical image stabilization|optical image stabilization]]; * 50 MP [[telephoto lens]] with an ''f/2.0'' aperture, 3.2x optical zoom, phase detection autofocus, and optical image stabilization; * 50 MP [[Ultra wide angle lens|ultrawide-angle lens]] with an ''f/2.2'' aperture, a 115° [[field of view]], and [[autofocus]] on the Pro model. On the other hand, the Xiaomi 14 Ultra features quad-camera setup consisting of the following lenses * 50 MP 1-inch Sony LYT-900 wide-angle lens with an adjustable aperture ranging from ''f/1.6'' to ''f/4.0'', multi-directional phase detection autofocus, laser autofocus, and optical image stabilization; * 50 MP Sony IMX858 telephoto lens with an ''f/1.8'' aperture, 3.2x optical zoom, phase detection dual pixel autofocus, and optical image stabilization; * 50 MP Sony IMX858 periscope telephoto lens with an ''f/2.5'' aperture, 5x optical zoom, phase detection dual pixel autofocus, and optical image stabilization; * 50 MP Sony IMX858 ultrawide-angle lens with an ''f/1.8'' aperture, a 123° field of view, and phase detection dual pixel autofocus. In addition, the Xiaomi 14 Ultra features a [[Time-of-flight camera|TOF 3D camera]] for depth measurement. All models also use [[Leica Camera|LEICA]] [[Summilux|SUMMILUX]] optics. The main cameras of the Xiaomi 14 and Xiaomi 14 Pro can record video at up to [[8K resolution|8K]]@24[[Frame rate|fps]], while the main camera of the Xiaomi 14 Ultra can record video at up to 8K@30fps. All three models also feature a 32 MP [[front-facing camera]] with an ''f/2.5'' aperture and the ability to record video at up to [[4K resolution|4K]]@60fps. ==== Display ==== The models feature an [[Low-temperature polycrystalline silicon|LTPO]] [[AMOLED]] display with an adaptive 1–120 [[Hertz|Hz]] refresh rate, Dolby Vison, HDR10+, a 20:9 [[Aspect ratio (image)|aspect ratio]], a centered circular cutout for the front-facing camera, and an under-display optical fingerprint sensor. The display of the Xiaomi 14 has 6.36" [[diagonal]], 2670 × 1200 [[Image resolution|resolution]], and a 460 ppi [[pixel density]], while the display of the Xiaomi 14 Pro and Xiaomi 14 Ultra have 6.73" diagonal, 3200 × 1440 ([[1440p|QHD+]]) resolution, and a 522 ppi pixel density. ==== Sound ==== The smartphones feature stereo speakers with [[Dolby Atmos]] support. In the Xiaomi 14 the earpiece doubles as the second speaker, while the Xiaomi 14 Pro and Xiaomi 14 Ultra feature a dedicated second speaker on the top of the frame. ==== Memory ==== The Xiaomi 14 is available in 8 [[Gigabyte|GB]]/256 GB, 12 GB/256 GB, 16 GB/512 GB, and 16 GB/1 [[Byte#Multiple-byte units|TB]] memory configurations, while the Xiaomi 14 Pro and Xiaomi 14 Ultra are available in 12 GB/256 GB, 16 GB/512 GB, and 16 GB/1 TB memory configurations === Software === The Xiaomi 14 and Xiaomi 14 Pro are the first smartphones to receive the new [[HyperOS]] operating system, that succeeds MIUI. On both models, HyperOS is based on [[Android 14]]. Xiaomi 14 Ultra features the same software. Later, all three models were updated to HyperOS 2 based on [[Android 15]]. == See also == * [[List of large sensor camera phones]] * [[List of longest smartphone telephoto lenses]] == References == {{reflist}} == External links == {{Commons category|Xiaomi 14|Xiaomi 14}} * {{Official website|https://www.mi.com/ua/product/xiaomi-14/|Xiaomi 14 official website}} * {{Official website|https://www.mi.com/xiaomi-14-pro|Xiaomi 14 Pro official website}} * {{Official website|https://www.mi.com/ua/product/xiaomi-14-ultra/|Xiaomi 14 Ultra official website}} {{Xiaomi}} [[Category:Mobile phones introduced in 2023]] [[Category:Android (operating system) devices]] [[Category:Flagship smartphones]] [[Category:Xiaomi smartphones|14]] [[Category:Mobile phones with multiple rear cameras]] [[Category:Mobile phones with 8K video recording]]
